intro: Modecca trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with three distinct lobes and produces showy, pale pink to purple flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and wetland restoration projects.
